intro: Fumaria bastardii var. gussonei, commonly known as the Italian celandine, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and fleshy, ribbed stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and waste grounds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly waxy texture, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variety is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
